title: Target Sight VR
description: VR and First Person view-drive self-talk and event activation system
longDescription:
VR and First Person view-drive self-talk and event activation system. Target Sight VR will help you to solve a wide range of gameplay tasks based on where is the player and what he/she is looking at.

Best use case - explorational and quest-like games.


Video preview: YouTube

Try before buy: Google Drive

Documentation: Google Drive

How-to Video: YouTube


Gameplay Features:

  • Play a CUE when the event is triggered (see "List of triggered events").
  • Fire an Events when the event is triggered.
  • Activate/deactivate the other (type of BP_TSTriggerActor) Actors when the event is triggered.Â This makes possible to build chains of Actors linked together.


In-editor Features:

  • TriggerActor automatically draws the direction to the target (blue lines), to the activated (green) and deactivated (red) BP_TSTriggerActors.
  • At the time of editing the TriggerActor automatically finds TargetActor.


Capabilities:

  • 100% Blueprint;
  • Easy to use;
  • Availability of customizable parameters (a lot of them - see Documentation for more info!);
  • Works perfectly with the basic VR and FPS templates.
technicalDetails:
List of triggered events:

  • Play the first sound at the moment when the player enters the designated area.
  • Play the second (different from the first) sound, when being in the designated area the player looked in the direction of the Target. It is possible to use a Timer - the sound will be played only when the player continuously looks in the direction of the Target for some time.
  • Play an additional set of sounds (different from the first and second) when the player returns to the selected area and looks in the desired direction (a Timer can be used too). It is important that an additional set of sounds will be played only if the player has spent the specified time outside the designated area.


Event Dispatchers (StepInActivation, FirstActivation, NextActivation) avalaible.


Contains:

- 2 Actors

- 3 Textures (for Actor's badges + in-editor visualizations)

- 4 Materials (1 - master material and 3 - material instances)

- 1 Example Map


Platforms tested:

Windows

SteamVR / HTC Vive


Intended platforms:

Windows, Mac, Linux

SteamVR / HTC Vive, Oculus Rift
